curriculumStandard: New York State K-12 Social Studies Framework - Grade 11: United States History and Government
curriculumFocus: Comprehensive US History from colonial era to present, with emphasis on government, civil rights, and contemporary issues

topics.name: Colonial America
topics.description: Establishment of 13 colonies, colonial life, and diverse cultural foundations

media.title: The New World
media.relevance: Terrence Malick film about Jamestown and Pocahontas
media.notes: Beautiful cinematography; more historically accurate than Disney version

media.title: Squanto: A Warrior's Tale
media.relevance: Disney film about Squanto helping Plymouth colonists
media.notes: Shows Thanksgiving origins and Native American perspective

media.title: Desperate Crossing: The Untold Story of the Mayflower
media.relevance: History Channel documentary on Pilgrims' journey
media.notes: Detailed coverage of Mayflower voyage and Plymouth settlement

media.title: Colonial House
media.relevance: PBS series where modern families live as 1628 colonists
media.notes: Excellent for understanding daily colonial life

media.title: Saints & Strangers
media.relevance: National Geographic miniseries on Plymouth Colony founding
media.notes: Dramatized but historically informed; shows Pilgrim-Native relations

media.title: Crash Course US History: Colonization
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Jamestown, Plymouth

media.title: Crash Course US History: Colonial America
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Life in 13 colonies

media.title: Crash Course US History: Taxes & Smuggling
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Taxation without representation

media.title: Oversimplified: American Revolution (Part 1)
media.notes: [Quick Clip] HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

media.title: Oversimplified: American Revolution (Part 2)
media.notes: [Quick Clip] War through Treaty of Paris

media.title: Schoolhouse Rock: The Shot Heard Round the World
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Classic animated song

media.title: Hip Hughes: Boston Tea Party
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Detailed explanation

media.title: Crash Course US History: The Constitution
media.notes: [Quick Clip] How Constitution was made

media.title: Crash Course Government: Federalism
media.notes: [Quick Clip] State vs federal powers

media.title: Crash Course Government: Separation of Powers
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Checks and balances

media.title: Schoolhouse Rock: I'm Just a Bill
media.notes: [Quick Clip] ESSENTIAL classic

media.title: Schoolhouse Rock: The Preamble
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Memorize the preamble

media.title: Crash Course Government: The Bill of Rights
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Rights and freedoms

media.title: TED-Ed: How is Power Divided in the US Government?
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Animated explanation

media.title: Mr. Beat: All 27 Amendments Explained
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Comprehensive overview

media.title: Crash Course US History: WWI
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Neutrality to war

media.title: Crash Course US History: The Roaring 20s
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Jazz, Harlem, Prohibition

media.title: Crash Course US History: The Great Depression
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Crash and hardship

media.title: Crash Course US History: The New Deal
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Government response

media.title: Crash Course US History: WWII
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Pearl Harbor to V-J Day

media.title: Crash Course US History: The Cold War
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Domestic Cold War impact

media.title: Crash Course US History: Civil Rights
media.notes: [Quick Clip] MLK, marches, legislation

media.title: TED-Ed: The Montgomery Bus Boycott
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Civil Rights key moment

topics.name: Colonial Society and Economy
topics.description: Development of colonial economies, slavery, and social structures

media.title: Africans in America
media.relevance: PBS documentary on slavery from colonial era through Civil War
media.notes: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED - comprehensive look at slavery's origins in America

media.title: Roots
media.relevance: Remake following Kunta Kinte from Africa through slavery
media.notes: Shows Middle Passage and colonial slavery; intense but educational

media.title: Amistad
media.relevance: Spielberg film about 1839 slave ship rebellion
media.notes: R-rated; powerful but intense; select scenes for mature students

media.title: The Witch
media.relevance: Horror film depicting Puritan colonial life and beliefs
media.notes: R-rated; NOT for classroom; teacher reference on Puritan worldview

topics.name: Road to Revolution
topics.description: Causes of the American Revolution including taxation without representation and colonial protests

media.title: Johnny Tremain
media.relevance: Disney classic about young patriot in Boston
media.notes: Shows Sons of Liberty, Boston Tea Party from youth perspective

media.title: Liberty's Kids
media.notes: 40 episodes; specific episodes cover Stamp Act, Boston Massacre, Tea Party

media.title: America: The Story of Us - Rebels
media.relevance: History Channel episode on Revolutionary causes
media.notes: Modern production with reenactments

media.title: Sons of Liberty
media.relevance: History Channel miniseries on Samuel Adams and revolutionary leaders
media.notes: Dramatized; covers key events leading to Revolution

media.title: Crash Course US History: Industrial Economy
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Rockefeller, Carnegie

media.title: Crash Course US History: Westward Expansion
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Manifest Destiny

media.title: Crash Course US History: Immigration
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Great wave immigration

media.title: Simple History: Triangle Shirtwaist Fire
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Labor reform catalyst

media.title: Crash Course US History: Progressive Era
media.notes: [Quick Clip] TR, muckrakers, reforms

media.title: Crash Course US History: Women's Suffrage
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Fight for voting rights

topics.name: American Revolution
topics.description: Revolutionary War, major battles, and the fight for independence

media.title: Hamilton
media.relevance: Lin-Manuel Miranda musical covering Hamilton and Revolution
media.notes: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED - engaging musical; some language

media.title: The Patriot
media.relevance: Mel Gibson in Revolutionary War South Carolina
media.notes: R-rated for war violence; spectacular battle scenes; select clips

media.title: The Crossing
media.relevance: A&E film on Washington crossing the Delaware
media.notes: Jeff Daniels as Washington; shows Trenton turning point

media.title: John Adams
media.relevance: HBO miniseries covering Adams through Revolution and early Republic
media.notes: Paul Giamatti; Emmy winner; comprehensive founding era coverage

media.relevance: Musical about Continental Congress and Declaration
media.notes: G-rated musical; makes Declaration debates engaging

media.title: The Revolution
media.relevance: History Channel 13-part documentary on American Revolution
media.notes: Comprehensive coverage; select relevant episodes

topics.name: Declaration of Independence
topics.description: Writing and significance of the Declaration of Independence

media.relevance: Musical depicting the debates over Declaration
media.notes: Shows the compromises and debates in Congress

media.title: National Treasure
media.relevance: Adventure featuring the Declaration of Independence
media.notes: Fictional treasure hunt but promotes interest in founding documents

media.title: The Declaration of Independence
media.relevance: History Channel documentary on the document's creation
media.notes: Direct focus on the Declaration's writing and significance

topics.name: Constitution and Bill of Rights
topics.description: Constitutional Convention, creation of the Constitution, and Bill of Rights

media.title: A More Perfect Union: America Becomes a Nation
media.notes: Made for educational use; shows convention debates in detail

media.title: Schoolhouse Rock: The Preamble
media.notes: Memorable way to memorize the preamble

media.title: Schoolhouse Rock: I'm Just a Bill
media.notes: Essential civics education

media.title: John Adams - Episode 3: Don't Tread on Me
media.notes: Shows debates over Constitution and government structure

topics.name: Federalist Era
topics.description: Washington's presidency, Hamilton's financial plan, and early party politics

media.title: Hamilton
media.relevance: Musical covering Hamilton's financial plan and party conflicts
media.notes: Act 2 covers Federalist era; Cabinet battles are highlights

media.title: Washington
media.relevance: History Channel 3-part documentary on George Washington
media.notes: Covers presidency and early republic

media.title: The Duel
media.relevance: PBS American Experience on Hamilton-Burr duel
media.notes: Shows political conflicts of early republic

media.title: Crash Course US History: George Washington
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Precedents and leadership

media.title: Crash Course US History: Thomas Jefferson
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Louisiana Purchase

media.title: Oversimplified: War of 1812
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Often overlooked war

media.title: Crash Course US History: Age of Jackson
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Indian Removal, populism

media.title: Simple History: The Trail of Tears
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Indian Removal Act consequences

topics.name: Jefferson and Expansion
topics.description: Louisiana Purchase, Lewis and Clark Expedition, and westward growth

media.title: Lewis & Clark: Great Journey West
media.notes: Stunning visuals; excellent for teaching expedition

media.title: Lewis & Clark: The Journey of the Corps of Discovery
media.relevance: Ken Burns documentary on the expedition
media.notes: 4-hour comprehensive documentary

media.title: Jefferson in Paris
media.relevance: Nick Nolte as Jefferson in France
media.notes: Shows Jefferson's time in France; complex portrayal

topics.name: War of 1812
topics.description: Causes, course, and consequences of the War of 1812

media.title: The War of 1812
media.relevance: PBS documentary on the War of 1812
media.notes: Comprehensive 4-hour documentary

media.title: First Invasion: The War of 1812
media.relevance: History Channel documentary on the war
media.notes: Covers major battles and campaigns

media.title: The Buccaneer
media.relevance: Yul Brynner as pirate Jean Lafitte at Battle of New Orleans
media.notes: Classic Hollywood; shows Battle of New Orleans

media.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
media.notes: Not directly about 1812 but excellent for naval warfare context

media.title: Crash Course US History: Slavery
media.notes: [Quick Clip] ESSENTIAL - comprehensive

media.title: Crash Course US History: The Underground Railroad
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Harriet Tubman and freedom seekers

media.title: Crash Course US History: The Civil War Part 1
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Causes through 1862

media.title: Crash Course US History: The Civil War Part 2
media.notes: [Quick Clip] 1863 to Appomattox

media.title: Oversimplified: Civil War (Part 1)
media.notes: [Quick Clip] HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

media.title: Oversimplified: Civil War (Part 2)
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Through Reconstruction

media.title: Crash Course US History: Reconstruction
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Successes and failures

media.title: TED-Ed: The Atlantic Slave Trade
media.notes: [Quick Clip] Historical context

topics.name: Manifest Destiny
topics.description: Westward expansion, territorial acquisitions, and the ideology of Manifest Destiny

media.title: How the West Was Won
media.relevance: Epic covering 50 years of westward expansion
media.notes: Classic Cinerama epic; shows multiple aspects of expansion

media.title: The West
media.relevance: Ken Burns 8-part documentary on the American West
media.notes: Comprehensive; covers pioneers, Native Americans, Gold Rush

media.title: Far and Away
media.relevance: Tom Cruise in Oklahoma Land Rush story
media.notes: Shows immigration and land rush; spectacular cinematography

media.title: Wagon Train
media.relevance: Classic TV series following wagon train west
media.notes: Classic TV; shows pioneer challenges

topics.name: Trail of Tears
topics.description: Indian Removal Act and forced relocation of Native American tribes

media.title: We Shall Remain: Trail of Tears
media.relevance: PBS documentary episode on Cherokee removal
media.notes: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED - Native American perspective

media.title: Trail of Tears: A Native American Documentary Collection
media.notes: Primary sources and survivor accounts

media.title: The Trail of Tears: Cherokee Legacy
media.relevance: Documentary with Wes Studi narrating Cherokee removal
media.notes: Comprehensive Cherokee perspective

media.title: Into the West
media.relevance: Spielberg miniseries covering westward expansion including Native removal
media.notes: 6-part series; shows both settler and Native perspectives

topics.name: Mexican-American War
topics.description: War with Mexico, territorial gains, and debates over expansion

media.title: The Alamo
media.relevance: Battle of the Alamo during Texas Revolution
media.notes: More historically accurate than 1960 version; shows Texas independence

media.title: Davy Crockett: King of the Wild Frontier
media.notes: Classic Disney; romanticized but engaging

media.title: One Man's Hero
media.relevance: Irish soldiers who switched sides to Mexico
media.notes: R-rated; shows Mexican perspective; St. Patrick's Battalion

media.title: The U.S.-Mexican War
media.relevance: PBS documentary on the Mexican-American War
media.notes: 4-hour comprehensive documentary; both perspectives

topics.name: North vs South
topics.description: Growing differences between industrial North and agricultural slave-holding South

media.title: The Civil War (Ken Burns) - Episode 1: The Cause
media.relevance: First episode covers sectional tensions leading to war
media.notes: ESSENTIAL viewing for understanding Civil War causes

media.title: America: The Story of Us - Division
media.relevance: History Channel episode on sectional crisis
media.notes: Modern production; covers growing divisions

topics.name: Slavery System
topics.description: Institution of slavery, slave life, and resistance

media.title: 12 Years a Slave
media.relevance: True story of Solomon Northup, free Black man kidnapped into slavery
media.notes: R-rated; Academy Award winner; extremely powerful but intense

media.title: Harriet
media.notes: PG-13; excellent for teaching Underground Railroad

media.title: Underground
media.notes: TV-MA; NOT for classroom; intense but historically informed

media.title: Frederick Douglass: In Five Speeches
media.relevance: HBO documentary featuring Douglass's speeches performed by actors
media.notes: Powerful way to hear Douglass's actual words

media.title: The Good Lord Bird
media.relevance: Showtime series about John Brown's raid
media.notes: TV-MA; NOT for classroom; Ethan Hawke as John Brown

topics.name: Kansas-Nebraska and Bleeding Kansas
topics.description: Kansas-Nebraska Act and violent conflict over slavery in territories

media.title: Lincoln
media.relevance: Spielberg film includes Lincoln-era political debates
media.notes: Daniel Day-Lewis; focuses on 13th Amendment but shows political era

media.title: The Civil War (Ken Burns) - Episode 1
media.relevance: Covers Bleeding Kansas and pre-war tensions
media.notes: Essential for understanding lead-up to war

topics.name: The Civil War
topics.description: Major battles, military leaders, and course of the Civil War

media.title: The Civil War
media.notes: ESSENTIAL - select episodes for specific topics

media.title: Gettysburg
media.relevance: Epic depiction of Battle of Gettysburg
media.notes: Very long but excellent for Gettysburg; show in segments

media.title: Glory
media.notes: R-rated; but important story of Black soldiers

media.title: Gods and Generals
media.relevance: Prequel to Gettysburg; covers early war
media.notes: Confederate perspective; balance with Union stories

media.title: Cold Mountain
media.relevance: Civil War from Confederate deserter's perspective
media.notes: R-rated; shows war weariness in South

topics.name: Emancipation and War's End
topics.description: Emancipation Proclamation, end of war, and Lincoln's assassination

media.title: Lincoln
media.relevance: Spielberg film on Lincoln passing 13th Amendment
media.notes: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED - Daniel Day-Lewis Oscar winner

media.title: Free State of Jones
media.relevance: Mississippi County that seceded from Confederacy
media.notes: R-rated; shows Southern dissent from Confederacy

media.title: Killing Lincoln
media.relevance: National Geographic film on Lincoln assassination
media.notes: Based on Bill O'Reilly book; covers assassination
